text.title: part11_BDSM as business: Interviews with Dominatrixes

p.s: Yeah , it ’s cliché .

hi.s: If people come in with post-traumatic stress disorder , are there special considerations ?

p.s: Yeah .
Yes , I think we ’ve dealt with a lot of people who have those issues .

I ca n’t say I have had anyone who wanted to re-enact an
Abu Ghraib
experience , though .

s.hi: DS : Are there places you just wo n’t go ?

p.s: Psychological ?
No.
Yes , I have my boundaries , but I prefer not to define them .
I think everyone does .
It would always depend , it would be difficult to state what would be my boundary .
One minute it can be one thing , and another client might come in and say , “ Can you do this , this and that , ” and the answer is no .

hi.s: Have you ever had a session where you felt threatened ?

p.s: No. I feel quite safe here , because they know we outnumber them .

Okay , in terms of boundaries , if I ’m a sub and the man is a dom , I do n’t let him blindfold me AND put a gag in my mouth , because then there is no way to tell what he is going to do and alert anyone .
There are certain safe words that you use , and if people do n’t respect those boundaries then you remind them of the boundaries or else you can end the session .

s.hi: DS : Have you had to end a session ?

p.s: Yes .

s.hi: DS : Can you tell me about a time ?

p.s: One time somebody was really forceful about wanting to see my panties .
It was a trampling session , where you step on his face .

He wanted me to step on his face , but he
did n't
want me to step on his face , he wanted to look up my skirt .
So I ended the session and I told him I knew that he was doing that , because every time I tried to step on his face he would move it and try to look up my skirt .
So I ended it .
He was an asshole .

s.hi: DS : Will you do full nudity ?

p.s: No.
No.
Yeah , it ’s pretty common that we are topless .
No , I do n’t think so .

s.hi: DS : Why do you prefer not to do it ?

p.s: I just do n’t feel comfortable , and if I do n’t feel comfortable I just do n’t do it .
And I think a lot of people will do that because they want to please the customer and have them come back , but ultimately I do n’t think that is good for you psychologically .
Yes , if you are not 100 % with everything you do , then it ’s going to affect you .
